_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers
Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY - THOMASVILLE





1. Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:

Harcros is committed to protection of the environment through the process of continuous improvement and waste minimization in order to reduce its environmental footprint and increase operational efficiency.  Employees are required to comply with any applicable environmental laws.   Further, Harcros is committed to minimizing the impact of its operations on the environment through recycling and reuse, energy efficiency in manufacturing and transportation, and minimizing water consumption.



Harcros is also committed to the health and safety of its employees, neighbors, and business partners.  Demonstration of this commitment includes complying with applicable health and safety laws and implementing training, work procedures, and other requirements to safely perform activities. Harcros will control health and safety dangers, striving to attain continuous improvement in the health and safety management of our products, operations, and services.



2.The stationary source and regulated substances handled:

The facility is approximately 4 acres, with the primary purposes of chemical distribution. More specifically, this facility stores and distributes chlorine and sulfur dioxide in Department of Transportation (DOT) approved 150 pound cylinders and ton containers and are shipped in the same packages. This facility is also looking at storing and distributing ethylenediamine in DOT approved totes. Chlorine, sulfur dioxide, nor ethylenediamine are t used, manufactured, or repackaged at this facility.  Access to the site is restricted to Harcros employees, and authorized contractors and visitors.



3. The general accidental release prevention program and the specific prevention steps:

This distribution facility complies with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention and OSHA's Process Safety Management programs.   This facility is operated in accordance with recommendations f

rom The Chlorine Institute and with the Responsible Distribution Process of the National Association of Chemical Distributors. 



4. Five year accident history



Within the past 5 years, this facility has had no accidental releases that have resulted in deaths, injuries or significant property damage on-site, or known off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.



5.The emergency response program

This facility's emergency response program is based upon The Chlorine Institute's Pamphlet 64, Emergency Response Plans for Chlorine Facilities. This plan is reviewed annually and updated when required. All response team members attend annual CHLOREP refresher training including the use of response equipment on simulated leaks. We work closely with our suppliers, customers, public responders, and The Chlorine Institute to continuously improve our emergency response capabilities.





6. Planned changes to improve safety



This distribution facility was constructed in 1970 and has been operated by Harcros Chemicals Inc. since 1993.  We continue to participate in The Chlorine Institute and the National Association of Chemical Distributor programs, and to continue to improve our operations in accordance with Responsible Distribution Guidelines.  Over the next couple of years Harcros is upgrading its Fire Protection and Security systems.
